3.SceneDescription: Classroom. Joey is writing his name on the board, but turns around beforeNEWLINEhe’s done which causes him to write his name with a downward curve, and he thenNEWLINEunderlines it, and draws the line right through his name.

lines.Line: Good evening. I’m Mr. Tribbiani. And I will be teaching acting forNEWLINEsoap operas. Now um, on my first day as (proudly) Dr. Drake Remoray on Days of OurNEWLINELives, (looks for a reaction from his students, and gets none.) I learned that one ofNEWLINEthe most important things in soap opera acting is reacting, this does not mean actingNEWLINEagain, it means, you don’t have a line, but someone else just did. And it goes likeNEWLINEthis. (looks all intense for a moment and then gasps, the students cheer him) Thanks,NEWLINEthanks, a lot. Oh, by the way, before I forget to work in soap operas some of you willNEWLINEhave to become much more attractive. All right, moving right along

lines.Line: Okay, some tricks of the trade. 8.SceneDescription: Classroom, Joey is talking to his students.

lines.Line: (sadly) There will come a time in each of your careers when you’llNEWLINEhave a chance to screw over another soap opera actor. I had such an opportunity in theNEWLINErecent, present.
